intro: Pygeum parreavii, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits that contain sticky, viscid seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
